>
[Oil of Corpse Restoration](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2421)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Gatewalkers</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Oil" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=121" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #189: Dreamers of the Nameless Spires](/Sources.aspx?ID=195) pg. 77</row>

**Price** 150 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 2 hands

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><row>1 minute (Interact)</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Adlet spiritual leaders create this thick purple gel so that the dead can temporarily assume their appearance in life during ancestral worship ceremonies. Spreading it over the bones of an [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) creature or a lifeless corpse causes the gel to congeal, forming a cosmetic layer that covers or restores any missing or compromised flesh until the body mimics its appearance in life. The dead creature's flesh looks healthy and whole. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus on [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) checks to look like a living creature. The gel does not restore life or Hit Points and the flesh quickly rots away 8 hours after application.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
